issue.title: [CF 822] Meta Icons not showing timer text
issue.body:
I use separate groups of icons for each spec, and upon switching specs the meta icons stop showing OmniCC timer text even though the source icons do. I've noticed this started happening with one of the more recent updates and the only way to fix it is to /reload UI or log out and back in.

I have the latest version of TellMeWhen (6.2.1) and OmniCC (5.3.0) installed and there are no LUA errors when this happens.

Meta Icon Group:

^1^T^SStrata^SLOW ^SPoint^T ^Sy^N-1 ^Sx^N-18 ^t^SScale^N0.75 ^SPrimarySpec^b ^SLocked^B ^STree4^b ^SEnabled^B ^SColumns^N7 ^STree2^b ^SIcons^T ^N2^T ^SType^Smeta ^SIcons^T ^N1^STellMeWhen_Group4_Icon2 ^N2^STellMeWhen_Group4_Icon1 ^t^SName^S102560 ^SShowTimerText^B ^SEvents^T ^N1^T ^SType^SAnimations ^SAnimation^SACTVTNGLOW ^SEvent^SOnFinish ^t^Sn^N1 ^t^SShowWhen^N3 ^SEnabled^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^t^N3^T ^SType^Smeta ^SIcons^T ^N1^STellMeWhen_Group4_Icon4 ^N2^STellMeWhen_Group4_Icon3 ^t^SName^SStarfall ^SShowTimerText^B ^SShowWhen^N3 ^SEnabled^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^t^N4^T ^SType^Scooldown ^SName^SStarsurge ^SShowTimerText^B ^SEvents^T ^N1^T ^SType^SAnimations ^SAnimation^SACTVTNGLOW ^SEvent^SOnFinish ^t^Sn^N1 ^t^SShowWhen^N3 ^SEnabled^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^t^N5^T ^SType^Smeta ^SIcons^T ^N1^STellMeWhen_Group4_Icon6 ^N2^STellMeWhen_Group4_Icon5 ^t^SName^SCelestial~`Alignment ^SShowTimerText^B ^SEvents^T ^N1^T ^SType^SAnimations ^SAnimation^SACTVTNGLOW ^SEvent^SOnFinish ^t^Sn^N1 ^t^SShowWhen^N3 ^SEnabled^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^t^N6^T ^SType^Scooldown ^SShowTimerText^B ^SName^SRebirth ^SShowWhen^N3 ^SEnabled^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^t^N7^T ^SType^Scooldown ^SShowTimerText^B ^SName^Sinnervate ^SShowWhen^N3 ^SEnabled^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^t^t^SName^SBoomkin ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sicon^T ^SSpacingX^N5 ^SSpacingY^N5 ^t^t^STree3^b ^SConditions^T ^N1^T ^SType^SINPETBATTLE ^SLevel^N1 ^t^Sn^N1 ^t^t^N62102^S~`~| ^Sgroup^N5 ^^

comments.body:
Attachment Added: OmniCC.lua

OmniCC.lua

<p>omniCC config</p>


> Posted by CurseForge user nlvyper

Everything seems to be working fine for me. When I cast the three abilities being tracked while in balance spec, switch to resto, and then switch back to balance, the three meta icons are still properly displaying the cooldown timers for the icons that they are displaying.

Is this the proper way to reproduce the issue? Or should I be doing something different?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

<<reply 1525466>>

Below is my full profile which contains 3 groups for Resto spec only, and 2 groups for Balance spec. I also use Masque - Zoomed skin on the icons. From what I recall reverting to older pre-5.2 version of OmniCC was fixing this issue.

I usually go back and forth between specs throughout play session - Balance for dailies, Resto for raids.

> Posted by CurseForge user nlvyper

@Cybeloras: Go

After doing some additional testing, it looks like it has something to do with OmniCC setting "Automatically scale text to fit within frames". For whatever reason when this setting is unchecked, it causes the above issue on meta icons, but works fine on normal icons.

Edited Jun 4, 2013

> Posted by CurseForge user nlvyper

I really don't know what the issue might be here.

Quote:

After doing some additional testing, it looks like it has something to do with OmniCC setting "Automatically scale text to fit within frames". For whatever reason when this setting is unchecked, it causes the above issue on meta icons, but ...

You deleted that comment, so I'm guessing that this is not what is causing the problem?

Could you also try adding a [Duration] tag to text display of one of the icons that the meta icon is inheriting from and see if that will display the duration even when OmniCC won't display it?

Edited Jun 5, 2013

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

yeah, i deleted that comment because the issue was back, but I'll try your suggestion later tonight...


> Posted by CurseForge user nlvyper

@nlvyper: Go

Going back to OmniCC 5.1.3 fixed the problem for me so something must have changed in OmniCC code from 5.1 to 5.3 that causes this


> Posted by CurseForge user nlvyper

I can't find any differences in the code between the two versions that would be causing an issue like this. Do you have a custom OmniCC configuration group (https://github.com/tullamods/OmniCC/wiki/What-are-Groups%3F) defined for TellMeWhen icons?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

yes. It's "tmw" in the attached OmniCC.lua file.


> Posted by CurseForge user nlvyper

Does the problem still persist if you disable the rule? (go to the Rules tab for your tmw group and delete "TellMeWhen" from its rules)


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

I tried it and and didn't help :(. Could Masque possibly be the culprit? All icons are skinned with Masque - Zoomed.


> Posted by CurseForge user nlvyper

I suppose it could be, but that is the skin that I use and I have never had this issue.

Could you try with a fresh install of OmniCC 5.3 with a fresh configuration (move OmniCC.lua out of your <ACCOUNT>/SavedVariables folder to a safe place)? There was a setting that was changed between these two versions - OmniCC has code in place to upgrade your settings, but I don't know how rigid that code is against downgrading, so it is possible that something got screwed up there.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

<<reply 1553246>>

Here is what I've done:
1. Completely removed addons: TellMeWhen, Masque, and OmniCC.
2. Completely removed all config files from WTF folder for the above 3 addons.
3. Reinstalled latest release versions of the above addons.
4. Masque defaults to "Blizzard" skin and left at default.
5. OmniCC default setting used.
6. Opened WoW and disabled all the addons except for the 3 above.
7. Reimported TMW profiles using string import.
8. Tested meta icons on 2 separate TMW profiles.

Here is the result:

Masque addon enabled/loaded - problem persists and OmniCC timers do not show upon switching specs.

Masque addon completely disabled - meta icons function perfectly after numerous spec switches and OmniCC timers always show.

I hope this helps in troubleshooting.


> Posted by CurseForge user nlvyper

One more thing I've tried which seemed to fix the problem after doing the below addon reset.

With all addons enabled, I went into TMW Groups options, and set all groups to load for both specs.

For example, on my priest TMW profile I did the following on all 5 groups I have set up:

1. Primary Spec - checked;
2. Secondary Spec - checked;
3. Discipline - checked;
4. Holy - checked;
5. Shadow - checked.

I switched specs several times with no meta icon issues.


> Posted by CurseForge user nlvyper

Just tried this again on the PTR with the full and proper setup that you have described in #12 and I am still unable to reproduce the problem.

I'm afraid there isn't much else that I can do at this point.

Here is a video of what happens when I follow these steps: http://youtu.be/kBG2hMpwmmI


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

<<reply 1575164>>

Not a problem. You can go ahead and close this ticket. I appreciate your efforts! Thank you.


> Posted by CurseForge user nlvyper
